articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, James Oliphant
articles.description: Iran and Israel exchanged fresh attacks early on Saturday, a day after Tehran said it would not negotiate over its nuclear programme while under threat and Europe tried to keep peace talks alive.
articles.title: Iran, Israel launch new attacks after Tehran rules out nuclear talks

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish, Parisa Hafezi, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: European foreign ministers urged Iran on Friday to engage with the United States over its nuclear programme after high-level talks in Geneva aimed at opening negotiations for a new nuclear deal ended with little sign of progress.
articles.title: Europe foreign ministers see 'perilous' moment, urge Iran to talk to US

articles.author: Jonathan Allen, Luc Cohen
articles.description: Mahmoud Khalil, a legal permanent resident of the United States, says he is being punished for his political speech in violation of the U.S. Constitution's First Amendment.
articles.title: US judge orders release of pro-Palestinian activist Khalil

articles.author: Nathan Layne
articles.description: Vance Boelter's disguise wasn't perfect. The silicone mask was somewhat loose-fitting and his SUV's license plate simply read "POLICE" in black letters. But it was good enough on a poorly lit suburban street in the dead of night.
articles.title: Two days of terror: How the Minnesota shooter evaded police and got caught

articles.author: Roberto Mignucci
articles.description: Salvage experts lifted Mike Lynch's sunken superyacht to the surface and began pumping seawater out of it on Saturday, 10 months after it sank off the coast of Sicily, killing the British tech tycoon, his teenage daughter and five others.
articles.title: Tech tycoon Lynch's doomed Bayesian yacht lifted to surface

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India will never restore the Indus Waters Treaty with Islamabad, and the water flowing to Pakistan will be diverted for internal use, Home Minister Amit Shah said in an interview with Times of India on Saturday.
articles.title: India says it will never restore Indus water treaty with Pakistan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has called on Ukraine's Western partners to allocate 0.25% of their GDP to helping Kyiv ramp-up weapons production and said the country plans to sign agreements this summer to start exporting weapon production technologies.
articles.title: Ukraine asks allies to allocate 0.25% of GDP to boost its weapon production

articles.author: Aditya Kalra
articles.description: India's aviation watchdog has issued a warning to Air India for "repeated and serious violations" related to pilot duty scheduling and oversight, according to government directives reviewed by Reuters on Saturday.
articles.title: India's watchdog warns Air India for breaching pilots' flight duty timings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said on Saturday that Israel's attacks on Iran right before a new round of nuclear talks with the United States aimed to sabotage the negotiations, and it showed Israel did not want to resolve issues through diplomacy.
articles.title: Turkey's Erdogan says Israel attacks aimed to sabotage Iran nuclear talks

articles.author: Saeed Shah
articles.description: Pakistan said on Saturday it would recommend U.S. President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, an accolade that he has said he craves, for his work in helping to resolve the recent conflict between India and Pakistan.
articles.title: Pakistan to nominate Trump for Nobel Peace Prize
